title: Last Tango In Halifax series 5 spoiler pictures ahead of 2020 return
text:
Tim is back from New Zealand and it looks like he’s here to stay (Picture: ITV)

Christmas has well and truly come early because ITV has only gone and treated us to first look pictures of Last Tango In Halifax’s hotly-anticipated fifth series.

The Bafta-winning show, which follows the story of widowed pensioners and former childhood sweethearts Alan and Celia (Derek Jabobi and Anne Reid), is set to return in 2020 after four years off-screen and it looks like there’s plenty of drama on the horizon.

One snapshot shows Alan and Celia looking as happy as Larry stood in the garden of their new idyllic home in the Calder Valley, with the rolling hills in the background, while another shows the return of Alan’s brother Ted (Timothy West).

On top of that, a third spoiler photo sees Caroline (Sarah Lancashire) having an intense heart-to-heart with Gillian (Nicola Walker).

Should we be worried?

An official synopsis for the upcoming four-part series teased: ‘Alan and Celia are now seven years into their marriage but, having moved into a desirable bungalow with stunning views across the Calder Valley, ​they aren’t quite seeing eye to eye.

Alan and Celia look happy – but what’s really going on behind the scenes? (Picture: ITV)

Gillian and Catherine have their own issues to deal with (Picture: ITV)

‘It isn’t just their differing politics that’s a source of tension; Alan’s new supermarket job brings an unexpected challenge in the form of a wild local lad, and at Far Slack Farm Gillian faces trouble with a giraffe.’

It continued: ‘Meanwhile John (Tony Gardner) is back on the scene, and Caroline (Sarah Lancashire) finds herself entangled in an emotional debacle with someone at work.

‘Into all of this jets Alan’s brother Ted on holiday from New Zealand. But it turns out he’s only bought a one-way ticket… and he hasn’t come alone.’

Sounds like we’re in for an absolute treat.

Speaking of Last Tango In Halifax’s return, creator Sally Wainwright enthused: ‘Yet again the entire Last Tango cast has proved to be so wonderful together, so uplifting, heart-warming, touching and funny, as they explore Celia and Alan’s relationship further, under the brilliant breath of fresh air that Gareth Bryn’s direction has given them.’
